intro: Satureja rivas-martinezii, commonly known as Rivas-Martinez savory, is a rare and endemic species native to the mountainous regions of central Spain. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is known for its essential oils and aromatic properties. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
